TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IObjectAdapter
.class public interface auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IObjectAdapter

Docs.summary: Defines the operations that can be performed on a JSON patch document.

MemberSignature.Value: public: void Add(Microsoft::AspNetCore::JsonPatch::Operations::Operation ^ operation, System::Object ^ objectToApplyTo);
public void Add (Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Add(class Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo) cil managed
Public Sub Add (operation As Operation, objectToApplyTo As Object)
abstract member Add : Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Object to apply the operation to.
Docs.summary:
Using the "add" operation a new value is inserted into the root of the target document, into the target array at the specified valid index, or to a target object at the specified location.
When adding to arrays, the specified index MUST NOT be greater than the number of elements in the array. To append the value to the array, the index of "-" character is used (see [RFC6901]).
When adding to an object, if an object member does not already exist, a new member is added to the object at the specified location or if an object member does exist, that member's value is replaced.
The operation object MUST contain a "value" member whose content specifies the value to be added.
For example:
{ "op": "add", "path": "/a/b/c", "value": [ "foo", "bar" ] }
See RFC 6902

MemberSignature.Value: public: void Copy(Microsoft::AspNetCore::JsonPatch::Operations::Operation ^ operation, System::Object ^ objectToApplyTo);
public void Copy (Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Copy(class Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo) cil managed
Public Sub Copy (operation As Operation, objectToApplyTo As Object)
abstract member Copy : Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Object to apply the operation to.
Docs.summary:
Using the "copy" operation, a value is copied from a specified location to the target location.
The operation object MUST contain a "from" member, which references the location in the target document to copy the value from.
The "from" location MUST exist for the operation to be successful.
For example:
{ "op": "copy", "from": "/a/b/c", "path": "/a/b/e" }
See RFC 6902

MemberSignature.Value: public: void Move(Microsoft::AspNetCore::JsonPatch::Operations::Operation ^ operation, System::Object ^ objectToApplyTo);
public void Move (Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Move(class Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo) cil managed
Public Sub Move (operation As Operation, objectToApplyTo As Object)
abstract member Move : Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Object to apply the operation to.
Docs.summary:
Using the "move" operation the value at a specified location is removed and added to the target location.
The operation object MUST contain a "from" member, which references the location in the target document to move the value from.
The "from" location MUST exist for the operation to be successful.
For example:
{ "op": "move", "from": "/a/b/c", "path": "/a/b/d" }
A location cannot be moved into one of its children.
See RFC 6902

MemberSignature.Value: public: void Remove(Microsoft::AspNetCore::JsonPatch::Operations::Operation ^ operation, System::Object ^ objectToApplyTo);
public void Remove (Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Remove(class Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo) cil managed
Public Sub Remove (operation As Operation, objectToApplyTo As Object)
abstract member Remove : Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Object to apply the operation to.
Docs.summary:
Using the "remove" operation the value at the target location is removed.
The target location MUST exist for the operation to be successful.
For example:
{ "op": "remove", "path": "/a/b/c" }
If removing an element from an array, any elements above the specified index are shifted one position to the left.
See RFC 6902

MemberSignature.Value: public: void Replace(Microsoft::AspNetCore::JsonPatch::Operations::Operation ^ operation, System::Object ^ objectToApplyTo);
public void Replace (Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Replace(class Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation operation, object objectToApplyTo) cil managed
Public Sub Replace (operation As Operation, objectToApplyTo As Object)
abstract member Replace : Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.Operations.Operation * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Object to apply the operation to.
Docs.summary:
Using the "replace" operation the value at the target location is replaced with a new value. The operation object MUST contain a "value" member which specifies the replacement value.
The target location MUST exist for the operation to be successful.
For example:
{ "op": "replace", "path": "/a/b/c", "value": 42 }
See RFC 6902
